title: Mitigating Multilingual Audio Text Retrieval Inconsistencies by Reducing Data Distribution Errors
author: Yuguo Yin (Peking University), Yuxin Xie (Peking University), Wenyuan Yang (Sun Yat-sen University), Dongchao Yang (The Chinese University of Hong Kong), Jinghan Ru (Peking University), Xianwei Zhuang (Peking University), Liming Liang (Peking University), Yuexian Zou (Peking University)
relevance_why: This paper addresses the issue of consistency in multilingual audio-text retrieval, which is closely relevant to the challenges faced in multi-modal audio generation and processing tasks that Haohe Liu is exploring.
background: The task involves retrieving audio clips or multilingual texts from databases ensuring high multilingual recall and retrieval consistency across different languages.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel approach called ATRI to solve the inconsistency in Multilingual Audio-Text Retrieval (ML-ATR), achieving improved retrieval recall and consistency metrics across multiple languages.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing ML-ATR methods struggle with random language sampling that affects model convergence and cross-modal alignment.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by introducing 1-to-K Contrastive Learning and Audio-English Co-Anchor Contrastive Learning, which significantly reduce data distribution errors and enhance performance.

key_innovation: The approach effectively pairs audio with all corresponding texts during training rather than selecting one randomly, thus correcting alignment errors.
real_world_impact: The findings advance the state-of-the-art in multilingual retrieval systems, enhancing applications in audio-based content retrieval and improving the user experience in multilingual environments.
limitations: The proposal uses a theoretical upper bound based on the stochastic gradient descent optimizer and may not generalize fully to other optimization strategies.

new_terms.Multilingual Audio-Text Retrieval (ML-AT: A process that matches audio content with corresponding text across different languages.
new_terms.Contrastive Learning: A machine learning technique that learns to differentiate between similar and dissimilar pairs to map them into a common representation space.

open_sourcing: The code will be available at https://github.com/ATRI-ACL/ATRI-ACL.
